abstract.text: Construct and manage a graphical, event-driven user interface for your iOS, iPadOS, or tvOS app.
A container view controller that manages a multiselection interface, where the selection determines which child view controller to display.
An object for managing and configuring the sidebar.
Called when a new drag session is requesting items to add to the existing drag session in the sidebar from the specified
Return items if the specified tab can add to the drag session, or an empty array if nothing should be added.
Called when a new drag session has begun in the sidebar from the specified
. Return drag items if the specified tab can be dragged, or an empty array if no drags should begin.
Note that if drag items are returned on tabs in groups that allow reordering, then tab reordering is disabled when the sidebar is not in editing.

Provide a compact, ergonomic tab bar for quick access to key parts of your app, and a sidebar for in-depth navigation.

abstract.text: The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
